name: MENU
description: Display a bar-type menu and prompt for a valid choice. The NMENU command is an alternative for accomplishing the same thing.
syntax: MENU AT starting_column,starting_row LEN length WDT width CPC choices_per_column FLD menu_lines_field CNTR counter_field NCH maximum_number_of_choices MCW choice_print_width ESC esc_key_label HELP help_label TTL menu_title HOLD

parameters.name: starting_column
parameters.description: Upper left corner of the menu, column value.

parameters.name: starting_row
parameters.description: Upper left corner of the menu, row value.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of rows long, including box around the menu. If there are two lines within the menu the length is 4.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Number of columns wide, including box around the menu. If the choices are 10 columns wide within the menu the total width is 12.

parameters.name: choices_per_column
parameters.description: If there are multiple columns in the menu this is the number of choices within a single column.

parameters.name: menu_lines_field
parameters.description: The array field that contains the menu lines. Each menu line is made up of 2 parts. The first is the displayed portion; this is what your user will see. The second is the control information. This consists of 5 characters. The first two characters indicate the starting column value for this line within the

comments: Display a bar-type menu and prompt for a valid choice. The NMENU command is an alternative for accomplishing the same thing.
